name: 1,2,3-propanetricarboxylic acid, 2-hydroxy-, tri
Reason: 1,2,3-propanetricarboxylic acid, 2-hydroxy-, tri has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is propane, which has a melting point of -18.7 °C. The hydroxyl group (–OH) introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, which can increase the melting point by approximately +5 °C. The carboxylic acid group (–COOH) also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular weight, estimated at around +10 °C. The presence of three tricarboxylic acid units (–COOC–) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +30 °C each.
